WorkItem.Description:
When I load my character from the armory, it doesnt load my talents... Also, the model (which is 'Bear' at startup) switches to 'Tree' after it loads my character.... 
Â 
In 2.2.11 this does work so its not a problem from within the armory I reckon :)

Comments.Message:
I cant seem to find an edit-button but I just wanted to add that the buff tab's checkbox settings are not being saved, which they also did in 2.2.11 to my recollection. 

Additionally (last thing then I'll be out of your hair :p), the suggested gem improvements for the 'Bear' model seem very off (no, havent reused gemmingtemplates), compared to pre-patch 3.2 - although I'm assuming there just hasnt been an Rawr.Bear update for 3.2 yet :)
Oh sorry, Character; Syphix, Realm; Bloodfeather, Region; EU

Same for me with Faerian on EU-Medivh. But it works with what you give me by mail yesterday, Astrylian.
Looking at the code, I succeed in make it work.
On ClassTalents.cs (line 4954), change :
private int[] _data = new int[85];
to :
private int[] _data = new int[100];

I don't know if it the same for all the Class (mine is a druid).

I'm no code genius but I know my way around on a PC... is there an easy explanation that could help me fix this as well?? I downloaded the rawr code and managed to change the line, I just dont know how I can go from my edited sourcecode into a functional Rawr :)

You will need a C# compiler, like Microsoft Visual C# 2008 Express Edition. 
Use it to open the project file (rawr.csproj or rawr.sln). Click on Build->Build Solution. With a slighty pinch of luck, it will create a rawr.exe file in the Rawr\bin\Debug or Rawr\bin\Release directory, depending on settings. 
There will probably also be a Data sub-directory into which you might want to copy your itemcache files. (Depending on how you downloaded the source files, you might have an empty item cache. Grab the xml files from the data sub-dir of your release version of rawr and place them into this new sub-dir. Or try replacing the exe and dll files in your release rawr version with the newly created files.)

If all of this sounds too complicated, wait a day or two, there will probably be another few quick releases as we try to nail down more 3.2 changes.
I'm also experiencing the "no talents" problem when updating my character, so I'm hoping the next update fixes the issue.  Meanwhile I'm using 2.2.11
Astrylian, it seems it worked fine on my DPSDK (Nadon / US-Earthen Ring); however when I tried to load my Bear (Naros / US-Earthen Ring) the talents didn't import.
